intro: Vieusseuxia, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. Native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean and the Middle East, Vieusseuxia thrives in saline and sandy soils. The plant is often found growing along sea cliffs and dunes, where it withstands harsh maritime conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an important component of coastal flora.
